lines.text: [after slicing one of the Black Knight's arms off]
Stop. Who would cross the Bridge of Death must answer me these questions three, ere the other side he see.
Ask me the questions, bridgekeeper. I am not afraid.
My name is Sir Lancelot of Camelot.
Oh, thank you. Thank you very much.
Stop. Who would cross the Bridge of Death must answer me these questions three, ere the other side he see.
Ask me the questions, bridgekeeper. I'm not afraid.
What... is the capital of Assyria?
[he is thrown over the edge into the volcano]
[he is also thrown over the edge]
Hee hee heh. Stop. What... is your name?
It is 'Arthur', King of the Britons.
What... is the air-speed velocity of an unladen swallow?
What do you mean? An African or European swallow?
Huh? I... I don't know that.
How do know so much about swallows?
Well, you have to know these things when you're a king, you know.
What makes you think she's a witch?
Well, she turned me into a newt!

[meekly after a long pause]
... I got better.
Well, I didn't vote for you.
Well how'd you become king then?

The Lady of the Lake, her arm clad in the purest shimmering samite held aloft Excalibur from the bosom of the water, signifying by divine providence that I, Arthur, was to carry Excalibur. THAT is why I am your king.

[interrupting]
Listen, strange women lyin' in ponds distributin' swords is no basis for a system of government. Supreme executive power derives from a mandate from the masses, not from some farcical aquatic ceremony.
I don't want to talk to you no more, you empty-headed animal food trough wiper! I fart in your general direction! Your mother was a hamster and your father smelt of elderberries!

[Sir Galahad the Chaste is being seduced by an entire castle full of young women]
We were in the nick of time. You were in great peril.
Yes, you were. You were in terrible peril.
Look, let me go back in there and face the peril.
Look, it's my duty as a knight to sample as much peril as I can.
No, we've got to find the Holy Grail. Come on.
Oh, let me have just a little bit of peril?
There are ways of telling whether she is a witch.
Are there? Oh well, tell us.
Tell me. What do you do with witches?
And what do you burn, apart from witches?
Good. Now, why do witches burn?
Good. So how do you tell whether she is made of wood?
Build a bridge out of her.
But can you not also build bridges out of stone?
No, no, it floats!... It floats! Throw her into the pond!
No, no. What else floats in water?
If she weighed the same as a duck... she's made of wood.

[after Arthur's cut off both of the Black Knight's arms]
Look, you stupid bastard, you've got no arms left!
[Holding the Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch]
How does it... um... how does it work?
Armaments, chapter two, verses nine through twenty-one.

[reading]
And Saint Attila raised the hand grenade up on high, saying, "O Lord, bless this thy hand grenade, that with it thou mayst blow thine enemies to tiny bits, in thy mercy." And the Lord did grin. And the people did feast upon the lambs, and sloths, and carp, and anchovies, and orangutans, and breakfast cereals, and fruit bats, and large chu...

And the Lord spake, saying, "First shalt thou take out the Holy Pin. Then shalt thou count to three, no more, no less. Three shall be the number thou shalt count, and the number of the counting shall be three. Four shalt thou not count, neither count thou two, excepting that thou then proceed to three. Five is right out. Once the number three, being the third number, be reached, then lobbest thou thy Holy Hand Grenade of Antioch towards thy foe, who, being naughty in My sight, shall snuff it.

lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: It is I, Arthur, son of Uther Pendragon, from the castle of Camelot. King of the Britons, defeater of the Saxons, Sovereign of all England!

lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: I am, and this is my trusty servant Patsy. We have ridden the length and breadth of the land in search of knights who will join me in my court at Camelot. I must speak with your lord and master.

lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds
1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: You've got two empty halves of coconut and you're bangin' 'em together.
lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: So? We have ridden since the snows of winter covered this land, through the kingdom of Mercia, through...

lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: Found them? In Mercia? The coconut's tropical!
lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: Well, this is a temperate zone
lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: The swallow may fly south with the sun or the house martin or the plover may seek warmer climes in winter, yet these are not strangers to our land?

lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: Not at all. They could be carried.
What? A swallow carrying a coconut?
lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: It could grip it by the husk!
It's not a question of where he grips it! It's a simple question of weight ratios! A five ounce bird could not carry a one pound coconut.
lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: Well, it doesn't matter. Will you go and tell your master that Arthur from the Court of Camelot is here?
Listen. In order to maintain air-speed velocity, a swallow needs to beat its wings forty-three times every second, right?
lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds
1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: I dunno, must be a king.
He hasn't got shit all over him.

[singing]
He was not in the least bit scared to be mashed into a pulp Or to have his eyes gouged out and his elbows broken To have his kneecaps split and his body burned away And his limbs all hacked and mangled, brave Sir Robin His head smashed in and his heart cut out And his liver removed and his bowels unplugged And his nostrils raped and his bottom burnt off And his penis...
That's enough music for now, lads.
Guards, make sure the prince doesn't leave this room until I come and get him.
Not to leave the room... even if you come and get him.
No, no. *Until* I come and get him.
Until you come and get him, we're not to enter the room.
No, no, no. You *stay* in the room, and make sure *he* doesn't leave.
And you'll come and get him.
We don't need to do anything, apart from just stop him entering the room.
Right. Oh, if, if, if, uh, if, if, uh, if, if, if, we... oh, if... oh...
Look, it's quite simple. You just stay here, and make sure he doesn't leave the room. All right?
Oh, I remember, uh, can he leave the room with us?
No, no, no, no, you just keep him in here, and make sure...
Oh yeah, we'll keep him in here, obviously, but if he had to leave, and we were with him...
No, just keep him in here...
No, not anyone else. Just me.
Right, we'll stay here until you get back.
And make sure he doesn't leave.
Yes, make sure he doesn't leave.
I thought you meant him. You know, it seemed a bit daft me I were to guard him when he's a guard.
[King of Swamp Castle turns to leave the room, both guards follow him]
No, no, no. I want you to stay here and make sure *he* doesn't leave.

[singing]
When danger reared its ugly head, he bravely turned his tail and fled.

[singing]
Yes, brave Sir Robin turned about, and valiantly, he chickened out.

[singing]
Bravely taking to his feet, he beat a very brave retreat. A brave retreat by brave Sir Robin.
[the Black Knight continues to threaten Arthur despite getting both his arms and one of his legs cut off]
Right, I'll do you for that!
What are you gonna do, bleed on me?
We are now no longer the Knights who say Ni.
We are now the Knights who say..."Ekki-ekki-ekki-ekki-PTANG. Zoom-Boing, z'nourrwringmm."
Can we come up and have a look?
Of course not. You're English types.
I'm French. Why do you think I have this outrageous accent, you silly king?
What are you doing in England?
You got us all worked up!
That's the most foul, cruel, and bad-tempered rodent you ever set eyes on!
You tit! I soiled my armor I was so scared!
Look, that rabbit's got a vicious streak a mile wide! It's a killer!
He'll do you up a treat, mate.
What's he do? Nibble your bum?
He's got huge, sharp... er... He can leap about. Look at the bones!
Go on, Bors. Chop his head off!
Right! Silly little bleeder. One rabbit stew comin' right up!
...and that, my liege, is how we know the Earth to be banana-shaped.
This new learning amazes me, Sir Bedevere. Explain again how sheep's bladders may be employed to prevent earthquakes.
Oh, but you can't expect to wield supreme executive power just because some watery tart threw a sword at you.
Come and see the violence inherent in the system. Help! Help! I'm being repressed!
Oh, what a giveaway! Did you hear that? Did you hear that, eh? That's what I'm on about! Did you see him repressing me? You saw him, didn't you?
[a man puts a body on the cart]

lines.character: The Dead Body That Claims It Isn't
The Dead Body That Claims It Isn't
The Dead Body That Claims It Isn't

lines.text: Well, he will be soon, he's very ill.

lines.character: The Dead Body That Claims It Isn't

lines.text: No you're not, you'll be stone dead in a moment.
Well, I can't take him like that. It's against regulations.
I don't want to go on the cart.
lines.character: The Dead Body That Claims It Isn't

lines.text: Oh, don't be such a baby.

lines.character: The Dead Body That Claims It Isn't

lines.text: Well, can you hang around for a couple of minutes? He won't be long.
I promised I'd be at the Robinsons'. They've lost nine today.
I think I'll go for a walk.
lines.character: The Dead Body That Claims It Isn't

lines.text: You're not fooling anyone, you know. Isn't there anything you could do?
I feel happy. I feel happy.
lines.character: The Dead Body That Claims It Isn't

lines.text: [the Dead Collector glances up and down the street furtively, then silences the Body with his a whack of his club]
Not at all. See you on Thursday.
[King Arthur has just cut the Black Knight's last leg off]
All right, we'll call it a draw.

[calling after King Arthur]
Oh, oh, I see! Running away, eh? You yellow bastards! Come back here and take what's coming to you! I'll bite your legs off!
On second thought, let's not go to Camelot. It is a silly place.
You don't frighten us, English pig dogs. Go and boil your bottoms, you sons of a silly person. I blow my nose at you, so-called "Arthur King," you and all your silly English K-nig-hts.

[about the inscription on the rock]
What does it say, Brother Maynard?
It reads, "Here may be found the last words of Joseph of Aramathia. He who is valiant and pure of spirit may find the holy grail in the Castle of Aaauuuggghhh... "
He must have died while carving it.
Look, if he was dying, he wouldn't have bothered to carve 'Aaaauuuggghhhh'. He'd just say it.
Well does it say anything else?
Do you think he could have mean, 'Camaaaauuuuggghhhh'?
Isn't there a Saint "Aaaaavvvveeeesss" in Cornwall?
No no no, it's "Aaaaauuuugggghhhh" from the back of the throat.
No I mean, "Whoooouuuuaaa!" as in surprise and alarm.
How do you do, good lady? I am Arthur, King of the Britons. Whose castle is that?
Well, we all are. We are all Britons. And I am your king.
I didn't know we had a king. I thought we were an autonomous collective.
You're foolin' yourself! We're living in a dictatorship. A self-perpetuating autocracy in which the working class...
Oh, there you go bringing class into it again.
Well, that's what it's all about! If only people would...
Please, please, good people, I am in haste. Who lives in that castle?
I told you, we're an anarcho-syndicalist commune. We take it in turns to be a sort of executive officer for the week...
...but all the decisions of that officer have to be ratified at a special bi-weekly meeting...
...by a simple majority in the case of purely internal affairs...
...but by a two thirds majority in the case of...
Be quiet! I order you to be quiet!
Order, eh? Who does he think he is?
Go and tell your master that we have been charged by God with a sacred quest. If he will give us food and shelter for the night, he can join us in our quest for the Holy Grail.
Well, I'll ask him, but I don't think he will be very keen. Uh, he's already got one, you see.
He said they've already got one!
Are you sure he's got one?
I'm not a witch, I'm not a witch!
But you are dressed as one!
And this isn't my nose. It's a false one.
Well, we did do the nose.
And the hat, but she is a witch!
Did you dress her up like this?
But she has got a wart!
[trumpets play a fanfare as the camera cuts briefly to the sight of a majestic castle]
Please! This is supposed to be a happy occasion. Let's not bicker and argue over who killed who.
Who are you who can summon fire without flint or tinder?
There are some who call me... Tim.
Man, sorry. What knight lives in that castle over there?
Well I can't just call you "man".
I didn't know you were called Dennis.
Well you didn't bother to find out, did you?
I did say sorry about the "old woman", but from behind you looked...
What I object to is you automatically treat me like an inferior.
Oh, king eh? Very nice. And how'd you get that, eh? By exploiting the workers. By hanging on to outdated imperialist dogma which perpetuates the economic and social differences in our society.

[singing]
We're knights of the Round Table, we dance whene'er we're able. We do routines and chorus scenes with footwork impec-cable, We dine well here in Camelot, we eat ham and jam and Spam a lot. / We're knights of the Round Table, our shows are for-mi-dable. But many times we're given rhymes that are quite un-sing-able, We're opera mad in Camelot, we sing from the diaphragm a lot. / In war we're tough and able, Quite in-de-fa-ti-gable. Between our quests we sequin vests and impersonate Clark Gable / It's a busy life in Camelot
I have to push the pram a lot.
You fight with the strength of many men, Sir Knight.
I am Arthur, King of the Britons.
I seek the bravest and the finest knights in the land who will join me in my court at Camelot.
You have proved yourself worthy. Will you join me?
You make me sad. So be it. Come, Patsy!
[attempts to get around the Black Knight]
I have no quarrel with you, good Sir Knight. But I must cross this bridge.
I command you, as King of the Britons, to stand aside!
[they fight until Arthur cuts off Black Knight's left arm]
[they fight again. Arthur cuts off the Knight's right arm]
We thank thee, Lord, that in thy mercy -
[cut off by the Knight kicking him]
You are indeed brave, Sir Knight, but the fight is mine!
Look, you stupid bastard. You've got no arms left!
No, I am Zoot's identical twin sister, Dingo.
I seek the Grail! I have seen it, here in this castle!
Oh, no! Oh, no! Bad, bad Zoot!
Oh, wicked, bad, naughty Zoot! She has been setting a light to our beacon, which, I've just remembered, is Grail shaped. It's not the first time we've had this problem.
Oh, wicked, bad, naughty, evil Zoot! Oh, she is a bad person, and she must pay the penalty!
Do you think this scene should have been cut? We were so worried when the boys were writing it, but now we're glad! It's better than some of the previous scenes I think.
At least ours was better visually.
At least ours was committed, it wasn't just a string of pussy jokes.
Oh, I am enjoying this scene!
Is there someone else up there we can talk to?
No, now go away or I shall taunt you a second time!

Follow. But! Follow only if ye be men of valor! For the entrance to this cave is guarded by a creature so foul, so cruel, that no man yet has fought with it... and lived! BONES of full fifty men lie *strewn* about its lair! So! Brave knights! If you do doubt your courage or your strength, come no further, for death awaits you all with nasty, big, pointy teeth...
[Makes fangs with his fingers and holds them in front of his mouth]
We live in a bloody swamp. We need all the land we can get.
Don't like her? What's wrong with her? She's beautiful, she's rich, she's got huge... tracts of land.
...You must cut down the mightiest tree in the forest... WITH... A HERRING!
Arthur, King of the Britons, your Knights of the Round Table shall have a task to make them an example in these dark times.
[the cartoon Knights are being chased by the animated Beast of Aaaaauuuugggggghhh]
And as the Black Beast lurched forward, escape for Arthur and his knights seemed hopeless, when suddenly, the animator suffered a fatal heart attack!

[back to the cartoon]
The cartoon peril was no more.
The quest for the Holy Grail could continue.
winter changed into spring, spring changed into summer, summer changed back into winter, and winter gave spring and summer a miss and went straight on into autumn... until one day...
Cut down a tree with a herring? It can't be done.
[the Knights of Ni scream and cover their ears]
I cannot tell! Suffice to say, is one of the words the Knights of Ni cannot hear!
How can we not say the word if you don't tell us what it is?
No, no, not "is". Wouldn't get very far in life not saying "is".
[after Bors is killed by the killer rabbit]
I *warned* you, but did you listen to me? Oh, no, you *knew*, didn't you? Oh, it's just a harmless little *bunny*, isn't it?
Pie Jesu Domine, dona eis requiem

lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: It could be carried by an African swallow.
Will you ask your master if he wants to join my court at Camelot?
Oh yeah, an African swallow, maybe, but not a European swallow. That's my point.
lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: But then the African swallow's not migratory...

[Bursts into the Prince's room and kneels before him after killing the guards]
Oh, fair one, behold, I am you humble servant Sir Launcelot. I have come to take
[looks up and realizes that he is kneeling before an effeminate Prince, not a Princess]
Uh, well, I got a note.
You've come to rescue me! I knew someone would! I knew that somewhere out there, there must be someone who
Stop that! Stop it! Stop it!
He's come to rescue me, father!
Well, let's not jump to conclusions.
Did you kill all those guards?
Well, the thing is, I thought your son was a lady.
Every time I try to talk to someone it's "sorry this" and "forgive me that" and "I'm not worthy"...
You only killed the bride's father, you know.
Didn't mean to? You put your sword right through his head.
Oh dear... is he all right?

[singing]
Bravely bold Sir Robin rode forth from Camelot. He was not afraid to die, oh brave Sir Robin. He was not at all afraid to be killed in nasty ways, brave, brave, brave, brave Sir Robin. He was not in the least bit scared to be mashed into a pulp, or to have his eyes gouged out, and his elbows broken. To have his kneecaps split, and his body burned away, and his limbs all hacked and mangled, brave Sir Robin. His head smashed in and heart cut out, and his liver removed, and his bowels unplugged, and his nostrils raped and his bottom burned off and his penis...
That's, uh, that's enough music for now, lads... looks like there's dirty work afoot.
O Knights of Ni, you are just and fair, and we will return with a shrubbery.

lines.character: Leader of The Knights who say NI!
Leader of The Knights who say NI!

lines.text: If it's one thing I can't stand, it's people groveling.
We are the Knights who say... NI.

When I first came here, this was all swamp. Everyone said I was daft to build a castle on a swamp, but I built in all the same, just to show them. It sank into the swamp. So I built a second one. That sank into the swamp. So I built a third. That burned down, fell over, then sank into the swamp. But the fourth one stayed up. And that's what you're going to get, Lad, the strongest castle in all of England.
Oh but if I went 'round sayin' I was Emperor, just because some moistened bint lobbed a scimitar at me, they'd put me away.
One day, lad, all this will be yours.
No, not the curtains, lad, all that you can see stretched out over the valleys and the hills! That'll be your kingdom, lad.
You must spank her well, and after you are done with her, you may deal with her as you like... and then... spank me.
And me. And me too. And me.
Yes. Yes, you must give us all a good spanking.
[Concorde has just been shot in the chest with an arrow bearing a message]
You fell out of the tall tower, you creep!
I was saved at the last minute.
[music begins playing, the townspeople begin dancing and singing, "He's going to tell, he's going to tell!"]
Not like that, not like that! No! Stop it! Nooo!
You don't frighten us with your silly knees-bent running around advancing behavior!

Meanwhile, not more than two swallow's flights away, Arthur and Bedivere had discovered something. Oh, that's an unladen swallow's flight away, obviously. There were more than two laden swallow's flights away, four really, if they had the coconut on a line between them. I mean, if the birds were walking, and dragging the coconut...
And now on to scene 24. A smashing scene with some lovely acting, in which Arthur discovers a vital clue, and in which there aren't any swallows, though I think you can hear a starling...
[he retches as he is apparently killed]
And after the spanking, the oral sex.
Well, I could stay a bit longer...
Are you saying Ni to that old woman?

Oh, what sad times are these when passing ruffians can say Ni at will to old ladies. There is a pestilence upon this land, nothing is sacred. Even those who arrange and design shrubberies are under considerable economic stress in this period in history.
Yes, shrubberies are my trade. I am a shrubber. My name is Roger the Shrubber. I arrange, design, and sell shrubberies.

[Arthur and Bedevere have found out that the Holy Grail is in Castle Augh, which is guarded by the frenchmen]
We shall attack at once.
[an army of hundreds of soldiers appears]

[to Castle Augh]
French persons, today the blood of many a brave knight shall be avenged! In the name of God, we shall not stop our fight till every one of you lies dead, and the Holy Grail returns to those who God Himself has chosen!
[the army charges forward, but is stopped by the police and the historian's wife]

[points to Arthur]
It's that one, I'm sure!

[turns to cameraman]
All right, sonny, that's enough, just take off.

[singing]
He is packing it in and packing it up And sneaking away and buggering off And chickening out and pissing off home, Yes, bravely he is throwing in the sponge.
Welcome, brave sir Knight. Welcome to the Castle Anthrax.
Yes... it's not a very good name, is it? Oh, but we are nice, and we'll attend to your every need.
Well, we'll not risk another frontal assault. That rabbit's dynamite.

[sings]
He is brave Sir Robin, brave Sir Robin, who...
Shut up! Nobody really, just passing through.
Shut up! Uh, n-n-nothing, really. J-j-just passing, uhm, just passing through.
Well, don't. It's just like those miserable psalms, they're so depressing. Now knock it off!
Well, now, uh, Launcelot, Galahad, and I, wait until nightfall, and then leap out of the rabbit, taking the French by surprise - not only by surprise, but totally unarmed!

lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: It is I, Arthur, Son of Uther Pendragon, from the castle of Camelot. King of the Britons, defeater of the Saxons, sovereign of all England.

lines.character: 1st soldier with a keen interest in birds

lines.text: Would it help to confuse it if we run away more?
Oh shut up and go and change your armour.
How dare you profane this place with your presence!
Dennis! There's some lovely filth down here!

[over a sweeping shot of mountains]
Once in a lifetime, there comes a motion picture which changes the whole history of motion pictures. A picture so stunning in its effect, so vast in its impact that it profoundly affects the lives of all who see it.
[dissolve to footage of King Arthur knighting Dennis]

[dismissively, trailer pauses]
Very good, thank you. Yes, thank you. Next, please.

[trailer footage restarts]
Once. In a. Life... time. There comes A... moh-tion pic-ture. Which... changes the 'hole... 'istory of moh... tion pictures. Eh...

[shouts as trailer footage restarts]
ONCE! IN A! LIFETIME!
What's wrong with my voice? My voice is alright, my brain is wrong...

[trailer footage restarts, subtitled]
Once in a lifetime there comes a motion picture which changes the whole history of motion pictures...

One such film is Kurosawa's "The Seven Samurai". Another was "Ivan the Terrible". Then there are more run-of-the-mill films like... "Herbie Rides Again", "La Notte", and "Monty Python and the Holy Grail".
[the castle model behind Arthur and Dennis falls over. Arthur unexpectedly runs Dennis through with his sword]
Bring out your dead! Bring out your dead!
Here you are, here's your ninepence.

lines.character: The Dead Body That Claims It Isn't

lines.text: Hang on, he says he's not dead!

lines.character: The Dead Body That Claims It Isn't
